Mitaka and not Newton.

This is a workaround for puppet-ceph, we'll get rid of it at the end of
Hammer support.

Change-Id: I257f181d483d63c72b097b6fb25acce352501aa6
"}]
commit_message:
puppet: workaround for puppet-ceph

Here is how works puppet-ceph module:
- puppet-ceph stable/hammer works with Puppet OpenStack stable/mitaka
- puppet-ceph master (future stable/jewel) works with Puppet OpenStack
  master (future stable/newton and beyond).

Because of that, we need to checkout puppet-openstack-integration with
the right ZUUL_BRANCH otherwise a patch in puppet-ceph stable/hammer
would try to checkout stable/hammer which doesn't exist and would
fallback to master and CI would fail because stable/hammer works with
Mitaka and not Newton.

This is a workaround for puppet-ceph, we'll get rid of it at the end of
Hammer support.

Change-Id: I257f181d483d63c72b097b6fb25acce352501aa6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/60/350860/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ZUUL_BRANCH=${ZUUL_BRANCH:-master} # Workaround for puppet-ceph, where we need to checkout # puppet-openstack-integration from stable/mitaka when working on stable/hammer. # Ceph Hammer works with Mitaka and before. # Ceph Jewel works with Newton and beyond. if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" == "stable/hammer" ]]; then ZUUL_BRANCH_REAL='stable/mitaka' fi /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner -m $CLONEMAP --cache-dir /opt/git \ --zuul-branch $ZUUL_BRANCH_REAL \

commit_message:

regex.

commit_message:
Make identity v3 services_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.

This patch makes identity v3 services_client list API accept
filter param.

Also add and correct doc string link.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Iac174a5d6ab650c4512d0961d10f83a9c23eee52

commit_message:
Wait for device removal/addition after ovs call

When adding or deleting an OVS interface, wait until
the device is actually gone or added before returning.

Closes-Bug: #1604816
Change-Id: I1fc6cd43796cd8671bb212e62ee4be7563e5ba23

subject: [PoC] Filter ironic nodes by chassis
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-28 11:01:19.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py', 'nova/conf/ironic.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/66bb0f79f25f1d588b6f461122095f4f4d7addb9', 'message': '[PoC] Filter ironic nodes by chassis

Add a new config option [ironic]chassis_uuid (default it None).

If this uuid is set, given Nova Compute service with ironic virt-driver will
only report and manage Ironic nodes that belong to this Ironic chassis.

This of course does not solve all the Nova-Ironic integration problems,
and is aimed to be an example on how to run multiple Nova computes with
Ironic virt driver while the Nova scheduler re-design is not finished.

Still, with the patch proposed there is no resource over-reporting,
and compute failure domain is narrower.

Operators would need to manually create same number of Ironic chassis as
there are Nova computes with Ironic driver planned/deployed,
distribute Ironic nodes between these chassis and
make the compute<->chassis mapping in the Nova configs for said computes.

Change-Id: I20117e3d9dfcaab8db0239f5bc11cdee21b31678
'}]
commit_message:
[PoC] Filter ironic nodes by chassis

Add a new config option [ironic]chassis_uuid (default it None).

If this uuid is set, given Nova Compute service with ironic virt-driver will
only report and manage Ironic nodes that belong to this Ironic chassis.

This of course does not solve all the Nova-Ironic integration problems,
and is aimed to be an example on how to run multiple Nova computes with
Ironic virt driver while the Nova scheduler re-design is not finished.

Still, with the patch proposed there is no resource over-reporting,
and compute failure domain is narrower.

Operators would need to manually create same number of Ironic chassis as
there are Nova computes with Ironic driver planned/deployed,
distribute Ironic nodes between these chassis and
make the compute<->chassis mapping in the Nova configs for said computes.

Change-Id: I20117e3d9dfcaab8db0239f5bc11cdee21b31678

commit_message:
Capture DatabaseError for deadlock check

Pymysql can raise 'lock wait timeout exceeded' errors
as InternalErrors. The previous filter was only catching
OperationalError exceptions. This patch changes it to
catch all DatabaseErrors, which both of the aforementioned
exceptions inherit.

Change-Id: If7bd1ceef6e5d64f0766b780616388c62862ce82
Closes-Bug: #1608691
(cherry picked from commit 3277ef33f2a1f6a892f0832e2907acef7b45dc2b)

commit_message:
UT: Fix "RuntimeError: stop called on unstarted patcher"

By removing explicit addCleanup calls.
and also change import '_' from neutronclient.i18n import _
to networking_l2gw._i18n import _.

Change-Id: I2001c0d0b00410188942c02f7b8b43d3d2fd5b22
Closes-Bug: 1608389

commit_message:
Kibana metrics

- auto detecting kibana process
- building configuration
- collecting metrics

Change-Id: I4c457b8396d8131fa18c76305a8f069626c51256
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/56/334856/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 FUJITSU LIMITED # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging import urllib2 import httplib2 import simplejson as json from monasca_agent.collector import checks from monasca_agent.common import util LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def _get_kibana_version(url): http = httplib2.Http(timeout=1000) resp = http.request( uri=url, method='HEAD' ) return resp[0]['kbn-version'] def _to_snake_case(word): final = '' for item in word: if item.isupper(): final += "_" + item.lower() else: final += item if final[0] == "_": final = final[1:] return final _ONE_MB = 1024 * 1024 class Kibana(checks.AgentCheck): def __init__(self, name, init_config, agent_config, instances=None): super(Kibana, self).__init__(name, init_config, agent_config, instances) def get_library_versions(self): return None def check(self, instance): config_url = instance.get('url') if config_url is None: raise Exception("An url must be specified") version = _get_kibana_version(config_url) dimensions = self._set_dimensions({ 'url': config_url, 'version': version }, instance) LOG.debug('Kibana version %s', version) stats = None try: stats = self._get_data(config_url) except Exception as ex: error_str = ('Error while trying to get stats from Kibana[%s] %s' % (config_url, str(ex))) LOG.error(error_str) if stats is None: LOG.warn('No stats data was collected from kibana') else: self._process_overall_status(stats, dimensions) self._process_metrics(stats, dimensions, instance) def _get_data(self, url): req = urllib2.Request(url, None, util.headers(self.agent_config)) request = urllib2.urlopen(req) response = request.read() return json.loads(response) def _process_overall_status(self, dimensions, stats): pass def _process_metrics(self, stats, dimensions, instance): # collect from instance which metrics should be checked instance_metrics = instance.get('metrics', {}) actual_metrics = {_to_snake_case(k): v for k, v in stats.get('metrics', {}).items()} instance_url = instance.get('url') if len(instance_metrics) == 0: return for im_name, im_enabled in instance_metrics.iteritems(): if not im_enabled: LOG.debug('%s has been disabled for %s check' % ( im_name, instance_url)) continue elif im_name not in actual_metrics: LOG.warn('%s not found in metrics %s received from %s' % ( im_name, actual_metrics.keys(), instance_url)) continue # ah, finally self._process_metric(im_name, actual_metrics.get(im_name), dimensions) def _process_metric(self, metric, stats, dimensions): LOG.debug('Processing metric %s' % metric) metric_list = self._parse_data(stats) averages = self._make_averages(metric_list) metric_name = self.normalize(metric, 'kibana') hostname = util.get_hostname() if metric == 'load': time_series = ['1m', '5m', '15m'] assert len(time_series) == len(averages) for it in xrange(len(averages)): avg = averages[it] ts = time_series[it] local_metric_name = self.normalize(ts, metric_name) self.gauge( metric=local_metric_name, value=avg, dimensions=dimensions, hostname=hostname, value_meta={ 'time_series': ts } ) elif metric == 'requests_per_second': self.rate( metric=metric_name, value=int(averages[0]), dimensions=dimensions, hostname=hostname ) elif metric in ['response_time_avg', 'response_time_max', 'heap_total', 'heap_used']: if metric in ['heap_total', 'heap_used']: averages[0] /= _ONE_MB metric_name = self.normalize('mb', metric_name) self.gauge( metric=metric_name, value=averages[0], dimensions=dimensions, hostname=hostname ) @staticmethod def _parse_data(data): metrics = [] for vector in data: flatten = vector[1] # discard timestamp if type(flatten) != list: flatten = [flatten] for it in xrange(len(flatten)): y = flatten[it] try: _ = metrics[it] except IndexError: metrics.insert(it, []) metrics[it].insert(0, y) return metrics @staticmethod def _make_averages(metric_list): def mapper(data): avg = 0.0 for val in filter(None, data): avg += val avg /= len(data) return avg return map(mapper, metric_list)

commit_message:
[WIP][Glare] Remove version/name restrictions from filters

Remove version/name restriction and let the user specify these
filters. Glare doesn't need to support this code.

Change-Id: I305d9fca9f099b5bad6366b0431f45adf4366934
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/47/348247/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: BaseArtifact interacts with database and saves/request artifact info def _parse_sort_values(cls, sort): sort = cls._parse_sort_values(sort)
deleted_lines: BaseArtifact interacts with database and saves/requesta artifact info def _parse_sort_values(cls, sort, filters): if key == 'version': if 'name' not in filters: msg = _LE("Cannot sort artifacts by version " "without specifying the name.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) else: name_op, __ = utils.split_filter_op(filters.get('name')) if name_op != 'eq': msg = _LE("Only 'eq' operator is allowed for " "name when sorting by version.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) if filter_name == 'version': cls._validate_version_filter(filters) if filter_name == 'visibility': cls._validate_visibility_filter(val) def _validate_version_filter(cls, filters): if 'name' not in filters: msg = _LE("Cannot filter artifacts by version " "without specifying the name.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) elif len(filters.getall('name')) > 1: msg = _LE("Name must be specified only once when " "filtering by version.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) else: name_op, __ = utils.split_filter_op( filters.get('name')) if name_op != 'eq': msg = _LE("Only 'eq' operator is allowed for " "name when filtering by version.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) @classmethod def _validate_visibility_filter(cls, value): if value not in ("private", "shared", "public"): msg = (_LE("%s is not valid visibility filter") % value) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) @classmethod sort = cls._parse_sort_values(sort, filters)

added_lines: #!/bin/bash # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # $1 = server/agent echo "deb https://download.go.cd /" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/gocd.list curl https://download.go.cd/GOCD-GPG-KEY.asc | sudo apt-key add - sudo apt-get update if [ "$1" == "server" ]; then sudo apt-get install -y go-server elif [ "$1" == "agent" ]; then sudo apt-get install -y go-agent else echo "Unknown node role" fi

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/77/347377/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _repository-workflow: Repository workflow ------------------- As a plugin developer, your repository workflow must be the following: #. Start your plugin development in your own repository open to public. The repository can be any public Git hosting; for example, GitHub. #. When you are ready to put your developed plugin project to the official repository in the OpenStack namespace, you need to do the following: * Have your code verified by the `Fuel team <https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/>`_. * Plan to set up a CI for the plugin. See :ref:`plugin-ci`. * Confirm that you are going to support the plugin for more than one version of Fuel. * Confirm that you are releasing your plugin code under an open-source license. * Confirm your plugin code has no binary files.

in order to follow the standard.

version of the hacking library.

commit_message:
Allow filter alarms with query including '/'

For example: mount_point=/
Django can't handle encoded URI correctly,
so this implementation uses base64url.

And allow filter alarms with dimensions having only key.

Change-Id: Ie23403278d4791c702abffd855cf0682510ac153

commit_message:
Add microversioning support for methods

Adds the functionality to allow versioning of api methods
based by adding a decorator api_version("min_version",
"max_version"). This is similar to how nova implemented api
versioning but updated to work with pecan.

Change-Id: Ie18d92531487f7c107b5132b3d35f38bd0a37aa0
Implements: blueprint api-versioning

commit_message:
Use seperate security group for o-hm0 port in devstack

OCTAVIA_HM_LISTEN_PORT is used for amphore to talk with o-hm.
This port need to be enabled in security group.

Change-Id: I686e49a502a1abf9afa5fc6b10d444fda98dc0d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/95/342695/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: neutron security-group-rule-create --protocol udp --port-range-min $OCTAVIA_HM_LISTEN_PORT --port-range-max $OCTAVIA_HM_LISTEN_PORT lb-mgmt-sec-grp

commit_message:
Add available params in compute clients' comment

Some interfaces in compute clients have **kwargs parameter, but no
api reference links are given. so this is to add "Available params" in
their comments.

Change-Id: Ib26bfd41f19927b6479ece753561e2b3a13fa1c4

commit_message:
Fix the use of both adhoc actions and "with-items" in workflows

The WithItemsTask previously skipped the validate_input call.
Adding this resolves the issues with input and with-items.

Closes-Bug: 1597640
Change-Id: Id6a1dad09d6f21e24861bd4292df7152843bd9f3
Co-authored-by: Dawid Deja <dawid.deja@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/96/337696/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_with_items_and_adhoc_action(self): wb_text = """--- version: "2.0" name: test actions: http: input: - url: http://www.example.com - method: GET - timeout: 10 output: <% $.content %> base: std.http base-input: url: <% $.url %> method: <% $.method %> timeout: <% $.timeout %> workflows: with_items_default_bug: description: Re-create the with-items bug with default values type: direct tasks: get_pages: with-items: page in <% range(0, 1) %> action: test.http input: url: http://www.example.com method: GET on-success: - well_done well_done: action: std.echo output="Well done" """ wb_service.create_workbook_v2(wb_text) # Start workflow. wf_ex = self.engine.start_workflow('test.with_items_default_bug', {}) self.await_execution_success(wf_ex.id) # Note: We need to reread execution to access related tasks. wf_ex = db_api.get_workflow_execution(wf_ex.id) task_execs = wf_ex.task_executions task1_ex = self._assert_single_item(task_execs, name='task1') task2_ex = self._assert_single_item(task_execs, name='task2') self.assertEqual(2, len(task_execs)) self.assertEqual(states.SUCCESS, task1_ex.state) self.assertEqual(states.SUCCESS, task2_ex.state)

commit_message:
Fixes jenkins failing on coverage report generation

Jenkins was failing when coverage report was getting gererated
as coverage combine deletes the reports and essentially and thus
was failing with the message no data found. This patch fixes it

Change-Id: I83ba65eff80181f06e712ea0a75e97919edf50ae

commit_message:
Adds comment on why nova needs to create console.log file

This change only adds a small comment on why nova is required to create
console.log. This comment is added after the corresponding code was
first deemed superfluous and was removed but had to be reverted back
in afterwards (see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/337174/1).
Partial-Bug: #1597644

Change-Id: Ife64f63e91f5f66bfe8c4b3e4109f3764f4d157f

commit_message:
Method to download file to VMware server

This patch adds a utility method in image_transfer to download
a file to VMware server.

Change-Id: Ic378d21d036f5296310697d73dbc6ee284fdd187
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/72/348872/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('oslo_vmware.rw_handles.FileWriteHandle') @mock.patch.object(image_transfer, '_start_transfer') def test_download_file(self, start_transfer, file_write_handle_cls): write_handle = mock.sentinel.write_handle file_write_handle_cls.return_value = write_handle read_handle = mock.sentinel.read_handle host = mock.sentinel.host port = mock.sentinel.port dc_name = mock.sentinel.dc_name ds_name = mock.sentinel.ds_name cookies = mock.sentinel.cookies upload_file_path = mock.sentinel.upload_file_path file_size = mock.sentinel.file_size cacerts = mock.sentinel.cacerts timeout_secs = mock.sentinel.timeout_secs image_transfer.download_file( read_handle, host, port, dc_name, ds_name, cookies, upload_file_path, file_size, cacerts, timeout_secs) file_write_handle_cls.assert_called_once_with( host, port, dc_name, ds_name, cookies, upload_file_path, file_size, cacerts=cacerts) start_transfer.assert_called_once_with( read_handle, write_handle, timeout_secs)

commit_message:
set relnotesdir to default inside config

Rather than using a default value in the function signature, look for
None and set the default. This allows callers to not have to look for an
option to be defined to decide when to pass relnotesdir or not.

Change-Id: I8535db2f35fa69faa009b4d368b21e25735016ee
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/reno refs/changes/26/350826/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, reporoot, relnotesdir=None): if relnotesdir is None: relnotesdir = defaults.RELEASE_NOTES_SUBDIR

commit_message:
Robust generating of routes

'netgroups[ngname]' is replaced with 'netgroups.get(ngname, {})' as
in other places in serializer.
Problem was the 'br-prv' endpoint that didn't have IP in case of VLAN
segmentation. The difference between 'netgroup_mapping' and 'netgroups'
exists only in case of using network template. Otherwise, absence of IP
for 'br-prv' did not lead to this issue.

Also, there is a small refactoring of serialization tests was made here.

Change-Id: I67616409017631023e707e533cb8e2faab943b34
Closes-Bug: #1556917
